that would arise by me staying there like the long drive to my job from her apartment would be a little over an hour compared to the 15 minutes from my house to work and how I would need to wake up way earlier. But she needed me right now and I couldn't leave her all alone and it would be good for me to have some company at this time too.

So, I told her "Sure mom." She said "Thank you dear." I said "No worries, want me to drive you to your apartment instead of taking the bus?" She said "That would be lovely, thank you again." I said "You're welcome" and we walked over to my car and I opened the door for her and helped her in.

She asked me if I could give her the auxiliary cord, so I said "The car doesn't have one, it uses Bluetooth." She asked me "Can you help me connect?" and I said "Sure, give me the phone." I typed in my car radio password then it connected and I gave it back to her. She thanked me and we started driving to her apartment.

As we were driving, I couldn't help but think about how my mom was coping with the loss of my dad. I wanted to help her, but I didn't know how. I decided that I would try to be there for her as much as I could and support her during this difficult time.

When we arrived at her apartment, I helped her inside and made sure she was comfortable. We talked for a while and I listened to her as she reminisced about my dad and shared some of her favorite memories with me. I tried to be supportive and understanding, even though it was hard for me to hear some of the things she was saying.

After a while, we both started to feel tired and we decided to go to bed. I promised her that I would be there for her and help her through this tough time. I know that it will be difficult, but I am determined to be there for my mom and help her in any way that I can.
